description: Solutions n to n^2 = a^2 + b^2 + c^2 (a,b,c > 0).
comments: All numbers not equal to some 2^k or 5*2^k [Fraser and Gordon]. - Joseph Biberstine (jrbibers(AT)indiana.edu), Jul 28 2006
references: T. Nagell, Introduction to Number Theory, Wiley, 1951, p. 194.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
O. Fraser and B. Gordon, On representing a square as the sum of three squares, Amer. Math. Monthly, 76 (1969), 922-923.
formula: a(n) = n + 2*log_2(n) + O(1). - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Sep 01 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Ralph Peterson (ralphp(AT)library.nrl.navy.mil)
extensions: More terms from _T. D. Noe_, Mar 04 2010
